application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Construction of enlarged lower ground floor level, and rear extensions at lower and ground floor levels, installation of two front-garden light-wells, new boundary treatment, along with re-cladding of existing rear dormer window and installation of two roof-lights in the front roof slope.
decision_conditions:
The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p>Details of materials</p><p>Full details, including physical samples made available on site or manufacturer’s illustration and specification, of all the materials to be used on the external surfaces of the building, including, but not limited to:the metal grille to the front lightwell;roof covering materials including slate;the bricks and pier caps to the front boundary;the bricks, coping stones and natural stone panel for the rear extension;shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before any work commences on site. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the significance of the locally listed building and the Conservation Area are conserved and in accordance with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework (July 2021), Paragraphs 194 to 208; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>No extraneous pipework</p><p>No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, plumbing, pipes, flues, vents or ductwork shall be fixed on the external faces of the building other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the significance of the locally listed building and the Conservation Area are conserved and in accordance with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework (July 2021), Paragraphs 194 to 208; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>External equipment</p><p>No new grilles, satellite dishes, aerials, meter boxes, security alarms, lighting, security or other cameras or other fixtures or plant shall be mounted on the external faces or roof of the building other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the significance of the locally listed building and the Conservation Area are conserved and in accordance with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework (July 2021), Paragraphs 194 to 208; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>Securing heritage benefits</p><p>The development and works which provide public benefits in the form of heritage benefits (which help weigh in favour of the approved scheme) as detailed in the approved Design and Access Statement, drawings and documents shall be undertaken prior to re-occupation of the building.&nbsp; For the avoidance of doubt these are primarily considered to be:</p><p>i) The replacement of the front rooflights with approved conservation rooflights;</p><p>ii) The reinstatement of the roof cresting with an approved type;</p><p>iii) The replacement of the front boundary wall, together with the railings and gate to an approved detail;</p><p>iv) The recladding of the rear dormer together with the provision of new dormer windows to approved details and design;</p><p>v) The replacement of the rainwater goods with cast iron types to an approved detail.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the public benefits, including the heritage benefits, of the approved scheme are secured and in accordance with Section 17 (3) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework (July 2021), Paragraphs 194 to 208; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non-Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>Details to be approved (general)</p><p>Detailed drawings and full particulars of the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of works.&nbsp; The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved:</p><p>i) Details of all new and replacement windows to the historic building (including the new windows to both the front lightwell and the rear dormer) consisting of 1:20 elevation drawings showing the pane pattern, together with 1:5 sections of the top, bottom, side and meeting rails and 1:1 sections of the glazing bars, showing the dimensions of the bars and the depth of double glazing units [Note: 12mm slimline units will be required];</p><p>ii) Details of the proposed rooflights in the form of a manufacturer’s illustration and specification [Note: these should be flush fitting, black painted steel, with a central glazing bar e.g. the Conservation Rooflight by the Rooflight Company];</p><p>iii) Details of the proposed roof cresting in the form of a manufacturer’s illustration and specification;</p><p>iv) Details of the proposed front railings and gate in the form of a manufacturer’s illustration and specification;</p><p>v) Details of the proposed metal guarding to the rear extension in the form of a manufacturer’s illustration and specification;</p><p>vi) Details of all windows and doors to the rear extension in the form of a manufacturer’s illustration and specification;</p><p>vii) Details of all proposed new and replacement rainwater goods in the form of a manufacturer’s illustration and specification.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the significance of the locally listed building and the Conservation Area are conserved and in accordance with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework (July 2021), Paragraphs 194 to 208; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non-Designated Heritage Assets.</p>
